document.heading: Prohibition of Discrimination in the Provision of Insurance Amendment Act of 1988

history.narrative: Law 7-208, the “Prohibition of Discrimination in the Provision of Insurance Amendment Act of 1988,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 7-364, which was referred to the Committee on Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 29, 1988, and December 13, 1988, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 6, 1989, it was assigned Act No. 7-279 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
